DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Plasma Cryovial Transfer Barcode Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence of characters that specifically identifies a particular cryovial of frozen biospecimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Plasma Cryovial Transfer Barcode
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another._A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.:The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.:A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.
A machine-readable representation of information in a visual format on a surface.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities
